definition: to blossom everywhere/to spring up all over the place/to flourish on a large scale
everywhere/all over/classifier for actions: one time
variant of 遍[bian4]
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
old variant of 花[hua1]
variant of 花[hua1]/flower/blossom/also pr. [wei3]

sentences.english: During this period, house churches boomed in popularity.
sentences.chinese: 在这段时期，家庭教会在中国遍地开花并风行一时。

sentences.english: The chain-like management springs up everywhere in the world.
sentences.chinese: 连锁经营在世界各地遍地开花。

sentences.english: After the TV program, ironic laughters spread everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 节目播出以后，一时间，啼笑声遍地开花。

sentences.english: Such a review need not be a full-blown code review.
sentences.chinese: 这样的回顾不需要遍地开花式的代码回顾。

sentences.english: SOA can flourish in a small organization environment as well.
sentences.chinese: SOA同样也能在小型组织环境中遍地开花。

definition: flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
lit. after rain, the spring bamboo (idiom); fig. rapid new growth/many new things emerge in rapid succession
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
(oil) blowout/surge/gush
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
Xinxing county in Yunfu 雲浮|云浮[Yun2 fu2], Guangdong/Xinxing or Hsinhsing district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
(of markets, industries, infectious diseases etc) rising/emerging/in the ascendant
rushing to stake one's claim in new markets
lit. arising suddenly above the level ground (idiom); sudden emergence of prominent new feature
to develop rapidly
rampant/very popular
a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC
to have become common practice (idiom)/to become a general trend
to make an amphibious assault/to seize a beachhead/to gain a foothold in (a new market)
to emerge to meet a historic destiny (idiom)/to arise at an opportune time/able to take advantage of an opportunity/to rise to the occasion
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
